The Regional Passport Office will not accept ration card as proof of identity or residence from passport applicants with effect from April 1, S. Lingasamy, Regional Passport Officer, Tiruchi, has said. In a press release, Mr. Lingasamy said the Ministry of External Affairs has decided not to accept ration cards following a gazette notification issued by the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution, Government of India, dated March 20 which stated that ration card shall not be used as a document of identity or proof of residence. The Ministry of External Affairs has listed 13 documents in its websitewww.passportindia.gov.inwhich can be submitted as proof of address along with passport applications, Mr.Lingasamy said.

Suvidha special

The Southern Railway will operate a Suvidha special train from Chennai Egmore to Kochuveli via main line on March 22 to clear the extra rush. The train Chennai Egmore–Kochuveli Suvidha (00657) special train will leave Chennai Egmore at 10.45 p.m. on March 22 and reach Kochuveli at 3.50 p.m.the next day. The train will stop at Tambaram, Chengalpattu, Villupuram, Mayiladuthurai, Kumbakonam, Thanjavur, Tiruchi, Dindigul, Madurai, Virudhunagar, Kovilpatti, Tirunelveli, Valliyur, Nagercoil Town, Eraniel, Kuzhithurai, Neyyatinkara and Thiruvananthapuram. The train will have one AC 2-tier, two AC 3-tier, 12 sleeper class and two luggage-cum-brake van coaches. Advance reservation for the train is open, a Southern Railway press release said.

Water level at Mettur

The water level at the Mettur Dam stood at 59.57 feet on Friday against its full reservoir level of 120 feet. The inflow was 203 cusecs and the discharge 1,500 cusecs.
title: Ration card is no longer ID proof
